english_translation: Narrated by al-Hasan: It reached Umar ibn al-Khattab about a man that he disliked something about. He said: So he wrote to him from Abdullah Umar, Commander of the Believers, to so-and-so: 'As for what follows, Ha-Mim. The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Mighty and Knowing (40:1-2) - meaning the Knowing of what I do; Forgiver of sins (40:3) - meaning if I seek forgiveness, I will be forgiven; Acceptor of repentance (40:3) - meaning if I repent, He will accept my repentance and forgive me; Severe in punishment (40:3) - meaning if I do not act, He will punish me; Possessor of bounty (40:3) - meaning possessor of favors and blessings upon me; There is no deity except Him, to Him is the return (40:3) - meaning to Him is my return, there is no escaping return to Him. He said: So his repentance became good, and he said: Allah has spoken the truth and Umar has given sincere counsel'
